intro: Ruschia pilosula, commonly known as the velvet leaf Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is commonly referred to as the "ice plant" family. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal, it is often cultivated in arid and semi-arid regions.
